column1: My little friend Mabel is passing the summer amid the Catskill Mountains. These mountains are in the State of New York
column2: on the west side of the Hudson River.Round Top and High Peak
column4: are about thirty-eight hundred feet above the level of the sea. They are well covered with forests
column6: when the leaves begin to change
column7: they make a very brilliant show.The Catskill-Mountain House is finely situated on a rocky terrace
column8: twenty-two hundred feet above the river. It is twelve miles from the village of Catskill
column9: and is much resorted to in the summer season.The prospect from this house is quite extensive. Mabel writes me that the view of the sunrise is grand; the air is cool and bracing; and the sight of the tops of trees rolling below
